Row.Text: The regional effects of this building extend six tiles (This does not apply to the adjacency bonus).
Tier two City Center building. Cannot be built in the same city as Cloister or Slaver. +10% [ICON_Science] Science in this city.
Tier one City Center building. Cannot be built in the same city as Gardens or Fighting Pits.
Egyptian replacement for the archaeological museum. Four slots for [ICON_GreatWork_Artifact] Artifacts instead of the usual two. Double theming bonuses.
+25% Tourism in this city. Trade routes from this city generate +2 [ICON_Culture] Culture and +2 [ICON_Science] Science.
Trade routes from this city generate +1 [ICON_Gold] Gold and +1 [ICON_Culture] Culture.
+25% Tourism from this city. Trade routes from this city generate +2 [ICON_Culture] Culture.
German replacement for the Steel Mill. In addition to the usual 2 [ICON_Housing] Housing to all cities in your Empire, this building provides +50% production toward Heavy Cavalry units in this city.

Creates 1 additional copy of [ICON_RESOURCE_BREAD] Bread. The regional effect of this building extends six tiles. [ICON_RESOURCE_RICE] Rice and [ICON_RESOURCE_WHEAT] Wheat resources gain +3 [ICON_Food] Food each.

Creates 1 additional copy of [ICON_RESOURCE_BREAD] Bread. The regional effect of this building extends six tiles. [ICON_RESOURCE_RICE] Rice and [ICON_RESOURCE_WHEAT] Wheat resources gain +3 [ICON_Food] Food each
German replacement for the Tavern. Provides +2 [ICON_Amenity] Entertainment instead of the usual 1, and has an extra citizen slot.
[ICON_RESOURCE_COFFEE] Coffee [ICON_RESOURCE_INCENSE] Incense [ICON_RESOURCE_TEA] Tea [ICON_RESOURCE_TOBACCO] Tobacco and [ICON_RESOURCE_WINE] Wine resources gain +2 [ICON_Gold] Gold each.
Tier three City Center building. Cannot be built in same city as Reliquary or Guild Hall.
[ICON_RESOURCE_CITRUS] Citrus [ICON_RESOURCE_SALT] Salt [ICON_RESOURCE_SPICES] Spices [ICON_RESOURCE_SUGAR] Sugar and [ICON_RESOURCE_TRUFFLES] Truffles resources gain +2 [ICON_Gold] Gold each.

Indian replacement for the Admin Center. Provides an additional +1 [ICON_Gold] Gold to International Trade Routes for all cities in your Empire. The regional effects of this building extend six tiles (This does not apply to the adjacency bonus).
Creates 1 copy of [ICON_RESOURCE_ANCHOVIES] Cans, a uniquely manufactured Luxury resource which provides +4 [ICON_Amenities] Amenities.
Creates 1 additional copy of [ICON_RESOURCE_ANCHOVIES] Cans. The regional effect of this building extends six tiles.
Trade routes from this city generate +3 [ICON_Gold] Gold.
Aztec replacement for the Garden. Provides +4 [ICON_Food] Food instead of the usual 2.
Tier two City Center building. Cannot be built in the same city as Agora or Slaver. +10% [ICON_Faith] Faith in this city.
The regional effects of this building extend six tiles.
Provides an additional 1 [ICON_Housing] Housing to all cities in your Empire.
The regional effects of this building extend six tiles (This does not apply to the adjacency bonus).

French replacement for the Food Company. [ICON_RESOURCE_TRUFFLES] Truffles and [ICON_RESOURCE_SPICES] Spices resources get +3 [ICON_Culture] Culture. The regional effects of this building extend six tiles.
Indian and English replacement for the Restaurant. Provides an additional +2 [ICON_Culture] Culture and +2 [ICON_Gold] Gold to [ICON_RESOURCE_SPICES] Spices in the city's boundaries.
Plus 10% Growth to all cities in your Empire.
The regional effects of this building extend six tiles.
Tier one City Center building. Cannot be built in the same city as Garden or Altar.
[ICON_RESOURCE_FISH] Fish and [ICON_RESOURCE_CRABS] Crabs resources gain +2 [ICON_Gold] Gold each.
The regional effects of this building extend six tiles.
Adds 1 [ICON_RESOURCE_IRON] Iron. Adds 1 [ICON_GOLD] to Copper and Mercury. Adds 1 [ICON_PRODUCTION] to Coal, Iron and ALuminum
American replacement for the Barracks. Grants access to the Manifest Destiny project.
Provides an additional 1 [ICON_Housing] Housing to all cities in your Empire.
Indian replacement for the shrine. Provides one copy of [ICON_RESOURCE_IVORY] Ivory.
Tier one City Center building. Cannot be built in the same city as Altar or Fighting Pits.
[ICON_RESOURCE_DIAMONDS] Diamonds [ICON_RESOURCE_IVORY] Ivory [ICON_RESOURCE_JADE] Jade [ICON_RESOURCE_PEARLS] Pearls and [ICON_RESOURCE_SILVER] Silver resources gain +2 [ICON_Gold] Gold each.
Tier three City Center building. Cannot be built in same city as Book Binder or Reliquary.
Plus 20% Growth to all cities in your Empire.
The regional effects of this building extend six tiles.
The regional effects of this building extend six tiles (This does not apply to the adjacency bonus).
+25% Tourism in this city. Trade routes from this city generate +2 [ICON_Culture] Culture and +5 [ICON_Gold] Gold.
+25% Tourism from this City. Trade routes from this city generate +1 [ICON_Culture] Culture.
Domestic trade routes from the city provide +1 [ICON_Food] Food and +1 [ICON_Production] Production.
Tier three City Center building. Cannot be built in same city as Book Binder or Guild Hall.
+50% Tourism in this city. Trade routes from this city generate +2 [ICON_Culture] Culture and +2 [ICON_Gold] Gold.
The regional effects of this building extend for six tiles.
Creates 1 additional copy of [ICON_RESOURCE_SAUSAGE] Sausage. The regional effect of this building extends six tiles.
Tier two City Center building. Cannot be built in the same city as Cloister or Agora. +10% [ICON_Production] Production in this city.
Creates 1 copy of [ICON_RESOURCE_SAUSAGE] Sausage, a uniquely manufactured Luxury resource which provides +4 [ICON_Amenities] Amenities.
+25% combat experience for all cavalry units trained in this city. Adds 1 [ICON_RESOURCE_HORSES] Horse.
Provides an additional 1 [ICON_Housing] Housing to all cities in your Empire.
[ICON_RESOURCE_CATTLE] Cattle and [ICON_RESOURCE_SHEEP] Sheep resources gain +1 [ICON_Food] Food each.
Japanese replacement for the restaurant. Provides +1 [ICON_Culture] Culture to [ICON_RESOURCE_FISH] Fish, [ICON_RESOURCE_CRABS] Crabs, and [ICON_RESOURCE_WHALES] Whales.
The regional effects of this building extend six tiles (This does not apply to the adjacency bonus).

Chinese and Japanese replacement for the Bodega. [ICON_RESOURCE_COFFEE] Coffee [ICON_RESOURCE_INCENSE] Incense [ICON_RESOURCE_TEA] Tea [ICON_RESOURCE_TOBACCO] Tobacco and [ICON_RESOURCE_WINE] Wine resources gain +2 [ICON_Gold] Gold each. [ICON_RESOURCE_TEA] Tea resources gain an additional +1 [ICON_Science] Science and +1 [ICON_Culture] Culture.
[ICON_RESOURCE_COTTON] Cotton [ICON_RESOURCE_DYES] Dyes [ICON_RESOURCE_FURS] Furs and [ICON_RESOURCE_SILK] Silk resources gain +2 [ICON_Gold] Gold each.
+25% experience to ranged units trained in this city.
Sumerian replacement for the Magistrate. Produces extra [ICON_Science] Science and [ICON_Production] Production for nearby cities at the expense of [ICON_Gold] Gold.

Egyptian replacement for the Visitors' Center. +50% Tourism in this city. Trade routes from this city generate +1 [ICON_Gold] Gold and +1 [ICON_CULTURE] Culture. In addition, artifacts throughout your empire generate +5 [ICON_Gold] Gold and +50% Tourism.
+50% Tourism in this city. Trade routes from this city generate +1 [ICON_Gold] Gold and +1 [ICON_CULTURE] Culture.
[ICON_RESOURCE_RICE] Rice and [ICON_RESOURCE_WHEAT] Wheat resources gain +1 [ICON_Food] Food each.
[ICON_RESOURCE_WINE] Wine resources within this city's borders gain +3 [ICON_Culture] Culture.
German replacement for the Smokehouse. Creates 1 copy of [ICON_RESOURCE_SAUSAGE] Sausage, a uniquely manufactured Luxury resource which provides +4 [ICON_Amenities] Amenities.
